newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: FPHC sees 2 bln peso yearly net by 2000.
newsitem.headline: FPHC sees 2 bln peso yearly net by 2000.

text.p: First Philippine Holdings Corp (FPHC) said it expects to generate annual profits amounting to two billion pesos by the year 2000, a company official said on Wednesday.

"We exceeded the billion peso level of net income for fiscal year 1996. This was originally our target for the year 2000. We have, therefore, reset our target to the two billion peso level by the year 2000," FPHC chairman Oscar Lopez said in a statement.
Lopez said the company plans to issue a 3 billion peso rights offering next year aside from its recent 2 billion long-term commercial paper (LTCP).
The 3 billion peso stock rights offer will be used to finance its projects including a 1,500-megawatt gas-fired power plant in Batangas, south of Manila.

FPHC reported a 1 billion peso net income for its 1995/96 fiscal year ended June. For the 1996/97 first quarter, it reported net profit of 381 million pesos against 195 million pesos during the same period last year.
